Hi,

  I'm using JUnit 4 and Mockito together.  I've built a stub of an obj=
ect to enable the testing of another class.  To support the stub I've writt=
en a class (implementing Answer for those familiar with Mockito) as a stand=
alone class rather than as an anonymous inner class, for readability.

  JU=
nit doesn't like my standalone helper class.  I get two errors:  "Test clas=
s should have exactly one public zero-argument constructor" and "No runnabl=
e methods".

  I must have something configured incorrectly but I can't fin=
d what that might be.  What am I doing wrong?  How do I keep JUnit from obj=
ecting to my test support classes?

Thanks,

Paul
